DataElement.preferredName: Chimerism Laboratory Procedure Tissue Donor Cell Detection Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the chimerism laboratory procedure detected donor cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chimerism Laboratory Procedure Tissue Donor Cell Detection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._The individual unit that makes up all of the tissues of the body. All living things are made up of one or more cells._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.:The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.
